verses.text: O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.
I will praise thee, O LORD , among the people: And I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
For thy mercy is great above the heavens: And thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: And thy glory above all the earth;
That thy beloved may be delivered: Save with thy right hand, and answer me.
God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;
Moab is my washpot; Over Edom will I cast out my shoe; Over Philistia will I triumph.
Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me into Edom?
Wilt not thou , O God, who hast cast us off? And wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?
Give us help from trouble: For vain is the help of man.
Through God we shall do valiantly: For he it is that shall tread down our enemies.

license.name: King James Version (KJV)
license.attribution: The King James Version (KJV) of the Bible is in the Public Domain. Text sourced from public domain editions.
